title: Euronews: In response to sanctions, Russia will refuse to pay in {dollars} - 2024-06-27 21:29:58
text:
/ world in the present day information/ The Ministry of Finance confirmed that the gradual transition in international commerce funds in nationwide forex has been going down in Russia for a number of years, stories Euronews. In accordance with Commerce Minister Denis Manturov, the brand new US sanctions will negatively have an effect on the provision of Russian items to 3rd international locations, so Moscow is ready to refuse to make use of the greenback in funds with them.
In response to the brand new sanctions, Moscow is able to abandon its international commerce funds in {dollars}. This was acknowledged by the Minister of Trade and Commerce of Russia. In accordance with him, within the first place, the sanctions may have a detrimental impression on the provision of Russian items to 3rd international locations, and in commerce with them, it is going to be potential to change to rubles or their nationwide currencies.
VIACHESLAV KHOLODKOV, an professional on TRAITS: Refusal to make use of the greenback in commerce funds is a blow to the US financial system, it’s our response to US sanctions. I’m positive that we’ll proceed to make use of this channel to answer America because it deserves.
The Russian Ministry of Finance additionally helps the thought of ​​switching to the ruble. They notice there that the transition to funds in nationwide forex has truly been going down for 5 years.
The brand new package deal of anti-Russian sanctions by the US got here into pressure on Wednesday. Specifically, restrictions are imposed on the vitality and monetary sectors, various state-owned enterprises and enormous businessmen, and in addition on the Russian nationwide sovereign debt. In Washington, the brand new sanctions are linked to the case of the 2 Skripals. In Moscow, they name the accusations of using toxic substances nonsense and discuss concerning the political-economic objectives of the anti-Russian restrictions.
